entry.title: Why Satoshi's temporary anti-spam measure isn'ttemporary
entry.summary: In a Bitcoin-dev email thread on July 30, 2015, Jorge Tim√≥n argued that even if lightning was never developed, the block size would remain at 1 MB forever and fees would rise to $10 per transaction. He went on to say that such high fees would still be very competitive compared to non-decentralized payment systems that have proportional fees. In response, Thomas Zander questioned how Bitcoin could survive when transaction space is so limited and paying $10 to be included becomes the norm. Zander suggested that Bitcoin could be outcompeted and replaced or eventually become worthless.
